did.head: Descriptive Summary

repository.label: Repository
repository.corpname: Stanford University. Libraries. Dept. of Special Collections and University Archives.

did.abstract: Professional correspondence, clippings, student papers, some early class work by Milgrom, notes, reprints, ephemera. His book collection is particularly strong in Bible and rabbinic literature.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: Collection is open for research; materials must be requested at least 24 hours in advance of intended use.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: Property rights reside with the repository. Literary rights reside with the creators of the documents or their heirs. To obtain permission to publish or reproduce, please contact the Public Services Librarian of the Dept. of Special Collections.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Jacob Milgrom papers, M1002. Dept. of Special Collections, Stanford University Libraries, Stanford, Calif.

bioghist.head: Biography / Administrative History
bioghist.p: Rabbi, author, and University of California at Berkeley Professor Emeritus Biblical Studies Jacob Milgrom was born in Brooklyn, New York on February 1, 1923. He studied at Brooklyn College before earning advanced degrees from the Jewish Theological Seminary. In 1948 he married Jo Milgrom (nee Berman), a biblical scholar in her own right; they have four children. Jacob Milgrom's research interests include Leviticus, the Dead Sea Scrolls, and Tannaitic literature; over the course of his distinguished career he published five books and more than two hundred articles. He was named a fellow of the Guggenheim Foundation, a fellow of the Institute for Advanced Studies in Jerusalem, and a senior fellow of the Algright Institute of Archaelogical Research. Rabbi Milgrom retired in 1992. He and his wife now reside in Jerusalem, Israel.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content of Collection
scopecontent.p: Clippings, photocopies, professional correspondence, student papers, writings by others, some early course work by Milgrom, notes, reprints, and ephemera.

controlaccess.head: Indexing Terms
controlaccess.p: The following terms have been used to index the description of this collection in the library's online public access catalog.

scopecontent.p: Printed, typed, and handwritten bibliographies from various sources.
Pages 241-253 from Anmerkungen zu Kapitel IV, undated.
Two calendars: Keren Hayesod United Israel Appeal, 1957/58 and 1959/60.
Agendas and other materials from various conferences, 1970s, 1980s, and undated.
17 notes, letters, and memos dating from 1960s, 1970s, and 1980s.
Three exam blue books written by Rabbi Milgrom. History I and History II dated May 17, 1945; Med[ieval] Hebrew Literature undated, ca. 1945.
Lectures notes from courses taken by Rabbi Milgrom, undated.
Typed notes from history course taken by Rabbi Milgrom, 1945.
Handwritten notes from courses taken by Rabbi Milgrom, 1943 and undated.
Handwritten notes from courses taken by Rabbi Milgrom, undated.
Typed notes from courses taken by Rabbi Milgrom, undated.
Handwritten notes from course on Ugaritic taken by Rabbi Milgrom, undated.
Typed notes from courses taken by Rabbi Milgrom, 1942 and undated.
Typed and handwritten notes from courses taken by Rabbi Milgrom, undated.
Handwritten notes from lecture attended by Rabbi Milgrom and Jo Milgrom, "Sabbath Eve Service in Babylonia," undated.
Typed outlines of courses taken by Rabbi Milgrom, dated 1943-44.
Typed outline of lecture series "Redemption of Israel and Return to Zion," World Jewish Bible Society, Jerusalem, ca. 1960.
Typed syllabus for religious school confirmation class, undated.
Typed course proposal: "Introduction to the Thought of A.J. Heschel," by Gary L. Austern. Undated.
Readings to accompany various lectures.
Readings to accompany various lectures.
Readings to accompany various lectures.
Readings to accompany various lectures.
Readings to accompany various lectures.
"Jerusalem Diary" kept by Rabbi Milgrom during tour of Israel. Undated.
Two directories. The Jewish Education Yellow Pages (Coalition for the Advancement of Jewish Education), 1993, and The Rabbinical Assembly of America, 1961.
Set of small cards for bible quiz game printed with quotations. Undated.
Bible quiz game. Undated.
Index to topics in Buber's Tales, prepared by Rabbi Elliot B. Gertel. Undated.
Studies in the Weekly Sidrah, by Nechama Leibowitz. English and Hebrew. 1950s.
Book. Masekhet avodah zarah min talmud bavli im perushe ve-tosafot masoret ha-shas. Vilna: defus ve-hotsaat ha-almanah veha-ahim rom, 662 [1901]. 126 p. Condition poor.

Two booklets. Mishnayot, by Eliezer Levi. New York: hotsaat Feldheim, undated. 14 p. Stamped "Property of Camp Ramah" on cover. Mishah meforeshet: masekhet brakhot, me'et Eliezer Levi. Tel Aviv: hotsaat Sinai: 721 [1961 or 62]. Stamped "Camp Ramah Conover, Wisconsin" on t.p.
Ten copies of three different blank ketubot [certifcates of marriage]. English and Hebrew, undated.
Tenoyim [marriage contract]. Blank form in Hebrew, printed by Ferlag fun Yehuda Katsenelenboygen, 66 Kanal Strit, Nyu York. Undated.
Two booklets. Mahzor: a prayerbook for the high holy days. Berkeley, CA: Kehilla Community Synagogue, 1985.Photocopy: Afternoon readings for Yom Kippur. Undated.

Looseleaf booklet. Cover reads: A Contemporary High Holiday Service, ed. by Rabbi Sidney Greenberg and S. Allan Sugarman. Bridgeport, CT: Prayer Book Press of Media Judaica, 1970. Some pages missing, out of order.

Two booklets. Mahzor for Rosh Hashanah and Yom Kippur: A prayer book for the days of awe. Berkeley, CA: The Aquarian Minyan, undated. 62 p.Untitled prayer book for Days of Awe. Beyt Chesed, compiled by Carol Delton, Patricia Warner-Cohn and Max Weinryb. Undated. 23 p.

Four booklets. A Prayer for divine aid (to be recited during the war), by Louis Ginzberg. Jewish Theological Seminary of America, undated.Sidur katan, by Zeev Folk. Jerusalem: Skorpyo 88, 753 [1992 or 93]. Inscribed "le-Yaakov ule-Yokheved be-birkat aliyah la-arets vela-torah, Berkli, 25 Shevat 754 [1993 or 94]. Yizkor Book of Remembrance. Richmond, VA: Temple Bethel, Dr. Jacob Milgrom, Rabbi. Undated, 24 p.Megilat Ester The Book of Esther, translated and revised by Rabbi Simon Glazer. New York: Ktav Publishing House, undated. Genizah Service, by Arie Becker. Photocopy, undated, 6 p.
Sermon outline material on Mordecai M. Kaplan supplied by Jewish Reconstructionist Foundation, Inc. Undated. 2 p. and cover letter, photocopied.
Small collection of tourist maps from Israel, Europe, and the US.
Handmade class memory book presented at end of school year to Jeremy Milgrom [son of Jacob and Jo Milgrom] upon leaving school in Jerusalem. 1992.
Four letters addressed to Jo Milgrom [wife of Jacob Milgrom]. 1963 and 1980s.
Offprints from 1930s and 1940s.
Offprints from 1950s.
Offprints from 1960s.
Offprints from 1960s.

Offprints from 1990s.
Four small sets of tourist postcards from Japan and Egypt, unused.
Six color prints. Arthur Szyk, "Rosh Hashana," "Succot," "Simchath Torah," "Chanukah," Purim," "Passover," and "Hillel." c. Arthur Rothmann Fine Arts, Inc., N.Y.C. Undated.
Four programs and event announcements.
Articles cut or torn from various publications.
Articles cut or torn from various publications.
Two newsletter issues: CLAL News and Perspectives, Nov. 1987 v.3 no.1.Unidentified "Newsletter # 1" having to do with archaeology in Israel. 6 p.; p. 1-2 missing. 1962-63.
Single issue, ha-Doar. New York: Hebrew Publishing Company, v XLIII, n. 23 (1908). April 5, 1963.
Single issue of Faith and Form: Journal of the Interfaith Forum on Religion Art and Architecture. Vol XXIII Winter 1989-90.

Development of the Amidah, by Louis Finkelstein in J.T.S.A. J.Q.R. Vol XVI, No. 1. Typewritten, annotated in ink. Undated.
The Firstling of Unclean Animals, by Gershon Brin, Tel Aviv University, Israel. Typewritten, annoted in ink, undated.
The Conservative Movement and the Synagogue, by Jack J. Cohen. Word processed [photocopy?], undated.

Six Sermon Lectures. The Vision of a Layman: "A Kingdom of Priests, a Holy People" by Rabbi Ralph Simon, Rodfei Zedek, Chicago IL. The Architect of Conservative Judaism: Solomon Schechter: As I knew him, by Rabbi Herman H. Rubenovitz, Rabbi Emeritus Temple Mishkan Teflia [sic], Newton, Mass.Teacher, Scholar, Martyr, by Rabbi Morris Adler, Shaarey Zedek, Detroit, MichiganThe Courage to Stand for Something: The Jew from Italy, Builder of American Judaism" and The Bold Adventurer: "A Pioneer for an Ancient Faith in a New Land," by Rabbi Saul I. Teplitz, Congregation Sons of Israel, Woodmere, Long Island.The Soul of a People: biographical outline of Hillel Bavli (1893-1961). Suggested Material for a Neilah Sermon for Seminary Year of Dedication, compiled by Louis M. Levitsky. All marked "(Not for Publication)," dated 1963-1964.
Book Review. Kathe Kollwitz: Life in Art. Submitted to Jo Milgrom from Student Mary J. Murphy. January 2, 1985.
Notebook: Avodah Zarah. Yerahmiel Hazan. Handwritten, 1961 or 1962.
"Notes on Moses Maimonides taken by Rabbi Leo Geiger, 1948."

Two essays: Freud on Moses and Monotheism, by Leo Strauss. Typewritten, undated.A Religion Like All Other Religions, by Harold M. Schulweis. Inscribed "For Jack and Jo with warmest regards Harold." Undated

Three essays. Non-Jews in a Jewish Polity: Subject or Sovereign? by David Novak. Undated.Jewish Unity: A Call for Cooperation and Mutual Respect. JWNA-religious Jewish Lay Leaders Dialogue convened by Am Jew Committee [sic]. Sept. 4 1986.From The Hymn of the Universe by Pierre Teilhard de Chardin. Undated.

Six essays. The Kyrenia Ship. Brief account of recovered artifacts, undated.The Holocaust and Theology, by Bernard M. Loomer. Two copies, undated.Israel: People and Land in Jewish Theology, by Ben Zion Bergman, University of Judaism. Undated.Christian Theology and the Holocaust, by A. Durwood Foster. Undated.Christian Beliefs and Anti-Semitism by: Charles Y. Glock and Rodney Stark: Comments on a Survey, by Shaun J. Sullivan, O.F.M. Paper given at Graduate Theological Union-University of Judaism colloquium May 6-8, 1975. People and Land in Christan Theology, by Wilhalm Wuellner, Professor of New Testament, Pacific School of Religion.
Various writings on Martin Buber on the occasion of his 80th birthday.
Two essays: Ritual Needlework: A Contribution of Jewish Women, by Joseph B. Horowitz. Undated.The Holocaust At Second Hand, by Chana Bloch. Undated.
Chapters from dissertation of Roy Gane. Dated 11/13/91.
